Name: Statistical Mechanics: Principles and Selected Applications (Dover Books on Physics)

ReviewList.Text: This includes Einstein Bose statistics, Dirac Fermi statistics which was very helpful to me when I started learning particle physics, and this may be an intermediate level introduction, but is highly recommended.
Thia is a classic text. I bought it for its discussion of the relationship between virial coefficients and thermodynamic functions. I found a clear but rigorous discussion.
Very good text if you have the other book by hill on 'stat thermo' or a  previous background on the subject, yet another Dover bargain.
Classic stat mech text.  Inexpensive enough to be on anyone's shelf who has a need to refer to some of the basics from time to time.  Out of date for current topics but the basics don't change.
